text: I love Pexels! I’m also a fan of Unsplash if you haven’t checked it out: <https://unsplash.com/>

just an idea I’ve been floating around in my head a long time… who would be interested in basically an open source repo for a modern version of the HubSpot Boilerplate.

The general purpose - provide a framework for building sites on HubSpot(that would work with both coded and drag and drop templates).  This framework would not lock you into using build tools, only things that HubSpot natively supports(like HubL vars and macros).

It would provide layout classes that work with the HubSpot injected classes. It would also try to only add enough styles to things to make it faster/easier to do common things, but not be opinionated.

The ultimate goal - Custom modules would be released to the marketplace built with this framework in mind, improving the interoperability of modules between sites. Also obviously improved performance and build out speed are the other main objectives.

anyone got any thoughts?
Take it a step further; make it a build system a la Foundation for Sites.

that’s basically where I’m going with my thinking, just trying to avoid getting too opinionated with the code so anyone can get into it and without adding too many styles that people basically have to override and whatnot

sure, the ideal I would think would be to give flavors (similar to foundation, again). You can download the straight CSS file for basic sites, or download the full starter repo to get local tools too. I'd be game for contributing to something like that.
I'd be interested
Yea I agree with that. I think the whole idea might need kinda some more discussion before anyone starts building it, so it’s not like we code our ways down a hole kinda thing
You lost me with both coded and drag and drop templates tho.... does that mean we need to essentially build it like a layer above Bootstrap 2
dammit Jon, we're developers. Code always comes first. We'll come up with use-cases later

kind of. I have a grid system that allows me to do almost everything you can do with bootstrap 3 on their old bootstrap 2 grid.  It’d just be a matter of supporting the HS injected classes which isn’t that big of a deal

alright well maybe in the next few days I’ll put up a repo, I’ll base it off the original HS boilerplate, then we can all modify the crap out of it.

My company has our own kinda framework, I’m not going to dump that in there but pull out some pieces that make sense so we can put something together that makes sense.
:+1::skin-tone-5:

:wreck it ralph: <https://play.google.com/music/m/T3tr44ctlmlz2yrq7ivi7377as4?t=Bug_Hunt_Noisia_Remix_-_Skrillex>

That’s what that makes me think of lol

*What should we call this framework?* <@U26BLKGE4> <@UAYMEC3LJ>

Completely spitballing ideas to throw get ideas flowing(these names could include HS or not):

• Bedrock
• CornerStone
• Wood (all the documentation can be filled with puns)
• Pykrete (kind of a joke since HubL is Jinja which is built on Python, also Pykrete is flipping amazing)
• Big Bang! (all the sites that spawn from this :eyes:)
• Thread or Thred to be fun.
• D’s Shirt - Referring to Dharmesh always wearing a T-shirt. would be hilarious one day if he brought it up in a speech
There already is a Bedrock I believe...
wouldn’t be surprised the name just makes sense
yeah, from the roots people
(It's actually pretty cool too: <https://roots.io/bedrock/>)
flywheel framework
Flywheel Boilerplate
If they're sticking with the "flywheel" terminology, I was going to say "crankshaft" <https://images.slideplayer.com/42/11334770/slides/slide_4.jpg>
Yes, that is an awesome idea
that’d be cool
another one that just sounds cool but isn’t HS related, and I garuntee it’s probably taken, gonna say it anyway: Carbon
digging crankshaft though

I think Crankshaft is cool then you can name parts like:
Pistons = modules
Balances = Scaffolding
and so on
my mechanic dad would be proud - he’d think I learned something about mechanics. Sadly I haven’t
It actually transfers ok, it's mainly systematic thinking, which we do. I'm building a hot rod with my grandpa right now, always surprises me how much overlap there is.
yea, engineering and programming are both careers that require a certain way of thinking
Well I think it’s settled until we come up with anything different. CrankShaft it is
CrankShaft. Love it, lol.
Just finished a Subaru EJ25 top-end build lol. Can we have full-time 4wd?
